day_0.headline: China Silences Critics Over Deadly Virus Outbreak
day_0.abstract: Beijing has responded faster to the new threat than it did with SARS, but it still silences and punishes those who veer from the official line, with potentially damaging consequences.

day_1.headline: Coronavirus Death Toll Climbs in China, and a Lockdown Widens
day_1.abstract: At least 25 people have died and more than 800 have been sickened by the mysterious illness, health officials said. The travel restrictions imposed on Wuhan were extended to at least four more cities.

day_3.headline: ‘Doorbell Ditch’ Prank Led to Crash That Killed 3 Teens, Officials Say
day_3.abstract: Prosecutors said that a Southern California man intentionally rammed into a car full of teenagers after they tricked him.

day_6.headline: Lesson of the Day: ‘What Is the Coronavirus? Symptoms, Treatment and Risks’
day_6.abstract: In this lesson, students will learn about the coronavirus using Times photographs, graphs and articles.

day_6.headline: Young Crash Victims Shared Kobe Bryant’s Passion for Basketball
day_6.abstract: Tuesday: More details emerge about the helicopter crash that killed Kobe Bryant. Also: An early encounter with the star.

day_6.headline: Kenya’s New Digital IDs May Exclude Millions of Minorities
day_6.abstract: Millions face hurdles in obtaining documents to get a biometric ID card that will be required to function in the country. Without one, “you are totally a living dead,” a human rights advocate said.

day_10.headline: Impeachment Then and Now: What Three Presidential Sites Can Teach Us
day_10.abstract: We visited the presidential museums, libraries and sites dedicated to Andrew Johnson, Richard Nixon and Bill Clinton to talk to visitors about the impeachment facing President Trump.

day_11.headline: He Assaulted His Girlfriend. Now He Wants a Political Comeback.
day_11.abstract: Hiram Monserrate, the first member of New York’s Legislature to be expelled in nearly a century, is running again.

day_12.headline: ‘BoJack Horseman’: Here Are the Best Animal Gags
day_12.abstract: The Netflix comedy’s animal-joke architect shares his favorites, and discusses why “the fact that we get so stupid lets us earn when we get so serious.”

day_12.headline: Mexico’s Last Countercultural Coast
day_12.abstract: On a wild stretch of Pacific shoreline, Costa Chica draws artists, architects, surfers, yogis and “naughty friends.”

day_12.headline: Lesson of the Day: ‘These Images Show the Sun’s Surface in Greater Detail Than Ever Before’
day_12.abstract: In this lesson, students will examine startling new images of the sun and consider the impact of these new discoveries.

day_13.headline: Balboa Island, Calif.: An Expensive Retreat for a Dedicated Following
day_13.abstract: The man-made island neighborhood in Newport Beach gets more and more crowded, despite the high-flying prices.

day_14.headline: Inside the Race to Contain America’s First Coronavirus Case
day_14.abstract: The health emergency is global, but in the United States, it is local public health officials who isolate the sick, trace “close contacts’’ and deliver thermometers.

day_15.headline: Nicolas Moufarrege Was a Student of Art History. This Work Shows It.
day_15.abstract: A mysteriously moving tapestry is a highlight of the artist’s Queens Museum retrospective.

day_15.headline: The Role of Memes in Teen Culture
day_15.abstract: Memes can provide an opening for parents to talk to adolescents about serious issues like coronavirus or the possibility of war.

day_18.headline: We’ve Never Seen the Sun’s Top or Bottom. Solar Orbiter Will Change That.
day_18.abstract: The NASA-European Space Agency spacecraft, which launched Sunday, will spend the next decade closely observing the sun.

day_20.headline: Chinese Students Abroad: How Are You Affected by the Coronavirus Outbreak?
day_20.abstract: The New York Times would like to hear from Chinese students living overseas — or planning to — about how their lives have been disrupted.

day_20.headline: Do Memes Make the Internet a Better Place?
day_20.abstract: Do these visual messages allow you to laugh about school, friendships or what your parents expect from you? Do they quickly inform you about the news — and make the world less scary? Or do they too often cross the line?

day_20.headline: Indonesia Has No Reported Coronavirus Cases. Is That the Whole Picture?
day_20.abstract: Experts find it astonishing that Indonesia has yet to announce a case despite hosting some 5,000 Chinese tourists a day in Bali before halting flights last week.

day_20.headline: Your Wednesday Briefing
day_20.abstract: Coronavirus, New Delhi election, New Hampshire primary: Here’s what you need to know.

day_20.headline: Shooting of Man in the Face by ICE Turns Into a Trump-New York Fight
day_20.abstract: The confrontation in Brooklyn illustrates the rising tensions between the Trump administration and so-called sanctuary jurisdictions.

day_27.headline: What’s Happening With Plans to Restructure PG&E?
day_27.abstract: Tuesday: An update on efforts to wrest the state’s largest utility from investors’ hands. Also: Kobe Bryant and the Lakers.

day_29.headline: Louis Armstrong, the King of Queens
day_29.abstract: The jazz musician’s impeccably maintained home in a modest New York City neighborhood is a testament to his — and midcentury design’s — legacy.

day_31.headline: Inside the New York City Bodegas Going Viral on TikTok
day_31.abstract: Captured on video, the unique culture of the colorful corner stores is winning fans around the world.

day_33.headline: What You Get for $3.5 Million in California
day_33.abstract: A 1923 beach house in Marina del Rey, a hillside home in Corona del Mar and a Spanish-style complex in Ojai.

day_33.headline: $3.5 Million Homes in California
day_33.abstract: A 1923 beach house in Marina del Rey, a hillside home in Corona del Mar and a Spanish-style complex in Ojai.

day_33.headline: ‘Recipe for a Massive Viral Outbreak’: Iran Emerges as a Worldwide Threat
day_33.abstract: Long a regional crossroads, Iran is spreading the new coronavirus to a host of neighboring countries. Many are ill equipped to cope.

day_35.headline: Ship Blocked From Jamaica and Cayman Islands Allowed to Dock in Mexico
day_35.abstract: After a crew member with flu symptoms was reported, Jamaican and Cayman health authorities refused to let passengers disembark.

day_37.headline: Asian Markets Seesaw, Bonds Rise as Coronavirus Fears Linger
day_37.abstract: Investors are betting on help from governments and central banks after last week’s share tumble and as economic indicators flash warning signs.

day_37.headline: Late Night Awaits Mike Pence’s Cure for the Coronavirus
day_37.abstract: The vice president has been put in charge of America’s response to the outbreak. “In other words, it’s been nice knowing you,” Conan O’Brien said.

day_37.headline: Right-Wing Media Says Virus Fears Were Whipped Up to Hurt Trump
day_37.abstract: Rush Limbaugh and Fox News pundits accused Democrats and journalists of “politicizing and actually weaponizing” an infectious disease.

day_38.headline: Here Comes the Coronavirus Pandemic
day_38.abstract: Now, after many fire drills, the world may be facing a real fire.

day_38.headline: Coronavirus Fears Reverberate Across Global Economy
day_38.abstract: The stock market had its worst week since 2008, signaling that one of the longest expansions in history could be ending. Policymakers said they were ready to act.

day_39.headline: As Another Election Looms, Israelis Ponder Politics, and Contagion
day_39.abstract: At an airport outside Tel Aviv, some passengers worried about flying away from a big vote, and into an epidemic.

day_39.headline: Panic Shopping for Coronavirus Supplies, but Brunch Is Packed
day_39.abstract: The first coronavirus case in New York City was confirmed Sunday night: a woman in her 30s who is isolated in her Manhattan home.

day_39.headline: On ‘S.N.L.’, John Mulaney and Jake Gyllenhaal Find Humor in the Coronavirus
day_39.abstract: Mulaney, the comic and former “S.N.L.” writer, and the cast took aim at Mike Pence, the Democratic presidential race and La Guardia Airport, among other targets.

day_40.headline: Surfaces? Sneezes? Sex? How the Coronavirus Can and Cannot Spread
day_40.abstract: What you need to know about how the virus is transmitted.

day_41.headline: The Coronavirus Is Us
day_41.abstract: We live in an interconnected world, where borders are porous, more like living membranes than physical walls.

day_41.headline: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
day_41.abstract: U.S. officials ramp up testing, after weeks of setbacks and missteps.

day_41.headline: Iran’s Coronavirus Response: Pride, Paranoia, Secrecy, Chaos
day_41.abstract: Iranian leaders once predicted the coronavirus epidemic ravaging China would not affect their country. Now Iran has among the most coronavirus deaths outside China, and Iranian medical workers have been told to keep quiet.

day_42.headline: Trevor Noah Picks a Sure Bet for Super Tuesday: Old Men
day_42.abstract: Noah joked that the Tuesday primaries were a chance for 14 states to “decide whether the Democratic nominee should be an old man or an even older man.”

day_43.headline: How Many Hotel Brands Is Enough?
day_43.abstract: Despite the crowded marketplace, hotel companies say there is an opportunity, even an imperative, to present an array of options. But the challenge is differentiating one brand from another.

day_43.headline: U.A.W. Corruption Case Widens as Former Chief Is Charged
day_43.abstract: Gary Jones, the United Auto Workers leader until last fall, is accused of embezzlement. A prosecutor spoke of a previous U.S. takeover of a union as a model.

day_43.headline: What Students Are Saying About the Coronavirus
day_43.abstract: We asked teenagers how worried they were about the outbreak. They told us how their schools are responding, how they’re sorting through disinformation, and why they’re concerned for their grandparents.

day_46.headline: New York in the Age of Coronavirus
day_46.abstract: As the number of cases climbs, a pall of anxiety has descended on the city.

day_46.headline: Surge of Virus Misinformation Stumps Facebook and Twitter
day_46.abstract: Secret labs. Magic cures. Government plots. Despite efforts by social media companies to stop it, false information about the coronavirus is proliferating around the world.

day_47.headline: President Trump Is Unfit for This Crisis. Period.
day_47.abstract: His narcissism is a grave danger to our health.

day_47.headline: President Trump on Vaccines: From Skeptic to Cheerleader
day_47.abstract: He once blamed vaccines for autism. Now he’s demanding the quick development of one for the coronavirus, but shows limited understanding of the science.

day_48.headline: Late Night Cries Uncle After Trump’s Coronavirus News Conference
day_48.abstract: Stephen Colbert was skeptical of the president’s suggestion that he could have been a “supergenius” like his uncle, who was a professor at M.I.T.

day_48.headline: Afraid of Coronavirus? I Know What That Fear Is Like
day_48.abstract: I live with chronic illness. Here is my advice for keeping calm in a health crisis.

day_49.headline: Coronavirus Resources: Teaching, Learning and Thinking Critically
day_49.abstract: A page we will continue to update with ideas for working, at school or at home, with content from The Times and other reliable sources about this global pandemic.

day_50.headline: Jimmy Kimmel Outlines the 5 Stages of the Coronavirus
day_50.abstract: They are denial, anger, bargaining, depression and, finally, acceptance, or as Kimmel described it: “Hey, you know what? If I die, maybe I’ll get to meet Prince.”

day_50.headline: We Need to Flatten the Curve. Trump and Fox Are Behind It.

day_51.headline: Pete Buttigieg Hosts ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live’ Without an Audience
day_51.abstract: The former presidential candidate wasn’t the only host taping in an empty studio on Thursday, as late night adapted to the coronavirus.

day_51.headline: At the Iranian Border, Iraqis Try to Keep a Virus From Entering
day_51.abstract: Iran has one of the world’s largest concentrations of the coronavirus. Iraq has had few cases, and wants to keep it that way. Things can get testy.

day_51.headline: Alex Jones Is Told to Stop Selling Sham Anti-Coronavirus Toothpaste
day_51.abstract: Mr. Jones, who has used his radio show and website to promote conspiracy theories, is falsely claiming his products can fight the virus.

day_51.headline: The Week in Tech: Gigs at Home, but Not What Start-Ups Intended
day_51.abstract: Many tech employees have the luxury of working from home in an emergency. But companies like Uber, Airbnb and WeWork could end up hurting.

day_51.headline: Israel’s Coronavirus Crisis Lets Netanyahu Seize the Initiative
day_51.abstract: Amid a yearlong political and legal imbroglio, a deadly contagion may give Israel’s embattled prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, a new lease on political life.

day_51.headline: The Government Has Failed on Coronavirus, but There Is Still Time
day_51.abstract: It will require swift, clear and aggressive action, but the country can avoid a worst-case scenario.

day_51.headline: Panicked Shoppers Empty Shelves as Coronavirus Anxiety Rises
day_51.abstract: The scene inside one crowded store: There was no chicken available, nor garbanzo beans or chips. Another had no flu or cold medicines.

day_53.headline: Suffering Through Your First Financial Crisis? Read This to Relax
day_53.abstract: We’ve been here before, and everything will be fine.

day_53.headline: A Sunday Without Church: In Crisis, a Nation Asks, ‘What Is Community?’
day_53.abstract: Canceled religious services are another symbol of a lost chance to be still, to breathe and to gather together.

day_54.headline: Germany's Financial Regulator Sees No Systematic Risk: Handelsblatt
day_54.abstract: Germany's financial regulator Bafin sees no systemic risk to the financial sector in Europe's largest economy due to the coronavirus pandemic, Handelsblatt reported on Monday.

day_54.headline: Mother of California Terrorist Pleads to Destroying Evidence
day_54.abstract: The mother of a terrorist who killed 14 people in a 2015 attack on a holiday party in California pleaded guilty Monday to destroying evidence, a government official said.

day_54.headline: Germany to Shutter Most Shops, Bars, Churches
day_54.abstract: Germany's federal and state governments agreed sweeping rules shutting everything from non-essential shops to bars, clubs, theatres, museums, brothels and churches in order to slow the spread of the coronavirus, the federal government said.

day_54.headline: EU Could Muster 28-40 Billion Euros Immediately to Support Firms Hit by Epidemic: EIB
day_54.abstract: The European Union could provide 28-40 billion euros immediately to support small and medium-sized companies hit by the effects of the coronavirus pandemic, the European Investment Bank said in a letter to EU finance ministers.

day_54.headline: EU Finance Ministers to Discuss Role for Rescue Fund's Fiscal Bazooka Against Virus
day_54.abstract: Euro zone finance ministers will discuss on Monday the possible use of an EU emergency fund worth more than 400 billion euros ($447.6 billion) to tackle the economic crisis caused by the coronavirus outbreak, officials said.

day_54.headline: Can Russia Use the Coronavirus to Sow Discord Among Americans?
day_54.abstract: Conditions are ripe: The pandemic is sweeping right into campaign season, and Trump’s response is highly contested.

day_54.headline: Some Ask a Taboo Question: Is America Overreacting to Coronavirus?
day_54.abstract: With “social distancing” now widely adopted nationwide, a small group of contrarians urge a more careful weighing of the harm as well as the benefits of such policies.

day_54.headline: To Battle Virus, 7 California Counties Order Everyone to Stay Home
day_54.abstract: On Monday, seven counties around Silicon Valley announced residents should not go out for three weeks except to meet “essential needs.”

day_54.headline: Parents Scramble as N.Y.C. Schools Close Over Coronavirus
day_54.abstract: The threat of the virus, the school system’s most serious challenge in decades, means 1.1 million students need child care and other resources.

day_55.headline: Montenegro Reports First Case of Corona Virus Infection
day_55.abstract: Montenegro has confirmed its first case of coronavirus infection in two female patients who had arrived 12 days ago from the United States and Spain, Prime Minister Dusko Markovic said on Tuesday.

day_55.headline: Dear Corona Diary: German Patient Gives Updates on Twitter
day_55.abstract: On the fifth day after she fell ill with COVID-19 respiratory disease, Karoline Preisler could breathe again without wincing through severe pain in her chest.

day_55.headline: Our New Historical Divide: B.C. and A.C. — the World Before Corona and the World After
day_55.abstract: Here are some trends to watch.

day_55.headline: South Africa Quarantines Cruise Liner Over Suspected Coronavirus Case
day_55.abstract: South Africa is holding the cruise liner MV AidAmira and a cargo vessel off Cape Town after a crew member on board one of the ships showed signs of the coronavirus, national ports operator Transnet said on Tuesday.

day_55.headline: German Coronavirus Vaccine Developer CureVac Denies Any U.S. Bid
day_55.abstract: CureVac, the German biotech firm at the center of a row over alleged U.S. attempts to gain access to an experimental coronavirus vaccine it is developing, denied on Tuesday it had received U.S. offers for the company or its assets.

day_55.headline: Swedish IKEA Store Finds 50,000 Forgotten Face Masks, Gives Them to Local Hospital
day_55.abstract: Staff at an IKEA furniture store on Sweden's west coast stumbled across a pile of around 50,000 face masks gathering dust in a warehouse and donated them to a nearby hospital this weekend.

day_55.headline: German CDU Leadership Contender Merz Has Coronavirus
day_55.abstract: Friedrich Merz, one of the most likely candidates to take over the leadership of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative Christian Democrats (CDU), said on Tuesday in a tweet that he had tested positive for coronavirus.

day_55.headline: Weekly News Quiz for Students: Special Coronavirus Edition
day_55.abstract: How informed are you about the coronavirus outbreak? How many of these 10 questions can you get right?

day_55.headline: We Lead Three Universities. It’s Time for Drastic Action.
day_55.abstract: Organizations nationwide need to get ahead of the coronavirus, even if it’s not in their community yet.

day_55.headline: In New York, Making a Life Out of Bottles and Cans
day_55.abstract: When the Brooklyn clothing factory where she worked closed its doors, Josefa Marín started picking up cans and bottles from trash cans to make ends meet.

day_56.headline: Dutch Minister for Medical Care Collapses During Coronavirus Debate
day_56.abstract: The Dutch minister for medical care collapsed briefly on Wednesday  during a debate in parliament on the coronavirus because of what he called exhaustion from weeks of intense work.

day_56.headline: Indian Guru's Tips to Ward Off Coronavirus Anger Health Professionals
day_56.abstract: Indian healthcare professionals are questioning claims by popular yoga guru and entrepreneur Baba Ramdev who said he has found an ayurvedic remedy that would help ward off coronavirus.

day_56.headline: Factbox: Public Figures Who Have Tested Positive for Coronavirus
day_56.abstract: Following are some of the public figures who have tested positive for coronavirus around the world:

day_56.headline: Is Coronavirus Widening Generational Divides, or Bridging Them?
day_56.abstract: Shutdowns have sometimes been interpreted through the prism of intergenerational tension, but in Europe there is also a call for an “internationale of generations.”

day_56.headline: Iran's Nowruz New Year, Typically Joyous, Haunted by Virus
day_56.abstract: At this time of year, the meandering arcades and alleys of Tehran's Grand Bazaar and other markets would usually be filled with shoppers rushing to stock up before the Persian New Year, Nowruz — a major holiday in Iran, when the entire country goes on vacation.

day_56.headline: From Flattening the Curve to Pandemic: A Coronavirus Glossary
day_56.abstract: Here are some of the terms and phrases you need to know to understand the virus and how it spreads.

day_56.headline: You Can Stream, but You Can’t Hide
day_56.abstract: Face-touching, communal snack plates — watching and streaming pre-coronavirus TV amid a shutdown, there’s always something there to remind you.

day_56.headline: They Clean the Buildings Workers Are Fleeing. But Who’s Protecting Them?
day_56.abstract: Janitors are going into offices to battle the invisible germs that threaten public health, sometimes without adequate protection or information about what they are facing.

day_57.headline: UK in Talks to Buy 'Game Changer' Coronavirus Antibody Test
day_57.abstract: Britain is in talks to buy a coronavirus antibody test that could be a game changer if it works and already scientists are making progress in finding medicines that can fight the disease, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Thursday.

day_57.headline: Exhausted Dutch Minister Leading Coronavirus Fight Quits
day_57.abstract: The minister leading the Dutch government's fight against the coronavirus resigned on Thursday, a day after collapsing from exhaustion during a parliamentary debate on the epidemic.

day_57.headline: Joshua-Pulev Heavyweight Title Fight Postponed Due to Coronavirus
day_57.abstract: Briton Anthony Joshua's world heavyweight title defence against Bulgarian Kubrat Pulev will be postponed by several months due to the coronavirus outbreak, the IBF's mandatory challenger said on Thursday.

day_57.headline: South Africa Clears Quarantined Vessels After Suspected Coronavirus Case
day_57.abstract: South Africa ports authority said on Thursday that tests have come back negative for those onboard a cruise liner and cargo vessel which had been held under quarantine off Cape Town's port limits due to a suspected coronavirus outbreak.

day_57.headline: ‘Wash Our Hands? Some People Can’t Wash Their Kids for a Week.’
day_57.abstract: In devastated northwestern Syria, the coronavirus may already be spreading in packed displacement camps, and the international response is weeks behind.

day_57.headline: Hundreds of Israelis Protest Netanyahu’s Strict Measures
day_57.abstract: Demonstrators, defying coronavirus fears, took to a main highway into Jerusalem to condemn what they say are antidemocratic moves by the prime minister since his March 2 election defeat.

day_57.headline: Public Figures Who Have Tested Positive for Coronavirus
day_57.abstract: These are some of the public figures who have tested positive for coronavirus around the world:

day_57.headline: How to Help Arts Workers Hurt by the Pandemic: Give, but Safely
day_57.abstract: As online campaigns to help those let go by cultural venues proliferate, experts say to be generous, but careful.

day_57.headline: How Trump’s Attacks on the Fed Have Made Its Job Harder
day_57.abstract: The Federal Reserve has moved quickly to combat economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic, but President Trump’s ongoing attacks may have weakened its message.

day_57.headline: What’s Going On in This Graph? | Flatten the Curve
day_57.abstract: How can protective measures like social distancing affect how the coronavirus outbreak impacts our society?

day_58.headline: ‘None of Us Have a Fear of Corona’: The Faithful at an Outbreak’s Center
day_58.abstract: A gathering of 16,000 at a Malaysian mosque became the pandemic’s largest known vector in Southeast Asia, spreading the coronavirus to half a dozen countries.

day_58.headline: BMW Will Idle South Carolina Plant for Two Weeks Starting April 3
day_58.abstract: BMW AG said on Friday it will temporarily close its South Carolina plant for two weeks starting April 3.

day_58.headline: German States Impose Measures to Keep People at Home to Contain Virus
day_58.abstract: The German states of Bavaria and Saarland said on Friday they were imposing restrictions for two weeks that aimed to keep people inside their homes to slow the spread of the coronavirus.

day_58.headline: Sri Lanka Imposes Curfew as South Asia Steps Up Coronavirus Battle
day_58.abstract: Sri Lanka imposed a nationwide weekend curfew on Friday as South Asian countries escalated efforts to check the spread of coronavirus across the densely populated region of 1.9 billion people.

day_58.headline: An Impromptu Wedding, Social Distancing Included
day_58.abstract: “Love in the time of Corona,” the invite said. “Bring your own cups if you want to toast.”

day_58.headline: Mosques Face Up to Pandemic as Friday Prayers Bring Coronavirus Risk
day_58.abstract: The coronavirus stopped communal Muslim prayers for the first time in living memory in many mosques from Indonesia to Morocco on Friday, but in some places believers have defied medical advice to join together in worship.

day_58.headline: Phone Sex Is Safe Sex
day_58.abstract: Please postpone your hookup. Get off on Skype instead.

day_58.headline: In Coronavirus Lockdown, Lebanese Banks Turn Off Dollar Tap for Hard-Hit Depositors
day_58.abstract: Since Lebanon was placed in lockdown to curb the spread of coronavirus, cash-strapped banks have cut access to dollars for depositors already separated from much of their savings by months of tightening controls.

day_58.headline: Restaurant Chain Vapiano Reports 'Cash Flow Insolvency'
day_58.abstract: German restaurant chain Vapiano SE on Friday said it was insolvent and would apply for government assistance to avoid formally filing for insolvency, blaming the coronavirus crisis for a drop in sales.

day_58.headline: Parents, Police Struggle to Herd the Young in Virus Outbreak
day_58.abstract: Teen: “I can't stay here all day. What about my friends!?”

day_59.headline: ECB Has Tools Left but Now Governments Must Fight Crisis: Schnabel
day_59.abstract: The European Central Bank (ECB) has all of its tools still available to mitigate the coronavirus crisis but it is time for politicians, particularly at a European level, to take action, ECB board member Isabel Schnabel told a German newspaper.

day_59.headline: Western Universities Rely on China. After the Virus, That May Not Last.
day_59.abstract: In Britain, the United States and Australia, the coronavirus could blow huge holes in the budgets of universities that have “become addicted to one source of income.”

day_59.headline: Americans See Trump's Virus Response Through Partisan Lens
day_59.abstract: As restaurants across the country stacked chairs on tables and shut their doors to try to contain the deadly coronavirus, what would be the final visitors streamed into the Conservative Grounds coffee shop in Largo, Florida.

day_59.headline: N.Y. Weighs Four Temporary Hospitals Sites, Including Javits Center
day_59.abstract: Gov. Andrew Cuomo said one million face masks were being sent to hospitals in New York City and another 500,000 to Long Island.

day_60.headline: Deniers and Disbelievers: ‘If I Get Corona, I Get Corona.’
day_60.abstract: Many have ignored the urgent calls for social distancing. How much they are worsening the coronavirus outbreak may never be known.

day_60.headline: Virus Rebels From France to Florida Flout Lockdown Practices
day_60.abstract: Young German adults hold “corona parties" and cough toward older people. A Spanish man leashes a goat to go for a walk to skirt confinement orders. From France to Florida to Australia, kitesurfers, college students and others crowd the beaches.

day_60.headline: Virus Rebels From France to Florida Flout Lockdown Practices
day_60.abstract: Young German adults hold “corona parties" and cough toward older people. A Spanish man leashes a goat to go for a walk to skirt confinement orders. From France to Florida to Australia, kitesurfers, college students and others crowd the beaches.

day_60.headline: Germany Bans Groups of More Than 2 to Stop Coronavirus as Merkel Self-Isolates
day_60.abstract: Chancellor Angela Merkel went into isolation after learning that her doctor had tested positive.

day_60.headline: First Coronavirus Cases Confirmed in the Palestinian Gaza Strip
day_60.abstract: The first two cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the densely-populated Gaza Strip, Palestinian health officials said on Sunday.

day_60.headline: Coronavirus Drives the U.S. and China Deeper Into Global Power Struggle
day_60.abstract: Many experts warn that an international health and economic crisis calls for more cooperation, not confrontation, between Washington and Beijing.

day_60.headline: Trump's Fate Tied to an Unknown: How Fast Economy Recovers
day_60.abstract: The coronavirus has flung the U.S. economy into a dangerous tailspin, and President Donald Trump's reelection hopes are caught in the sudden whirlwind.

day_61.headline: Mexico Border Referendum Cancels Massive Corona Brewery
day_61.abstract: The company that brews Corona beer took another blow on Monday when the federal government said it would not allow a massive, partly-built $1.5 billion brewery on the border after residents rejected it in a referendum.

day_61.headline: H&M Scraps Dividend Due to Coronavirus as All Costs Under Review
day_61.abstract: Sweden's H&M, the world's second largest clothing retailer, said on Monday it had decided to scrap its proposed dividend due to the coronavirus outbreak, and that it was reviewing all parts of its operations, including all costs.

day_61.headline: Call It ‘Coronavirus’
day_61.abstract: Disease and prejudice have long gone hand in hand. We can do better in 2020.

day_61.headline: Mexican Referendum Rejects U.S. Modelo Brewer in New Investment Blow
day_61.abstract: Residents of a Mexican city on the U.S. border voted against completing a billion-dollar brewery being built by Constellation Brands Inc, the government said Monday, dealing a fresh blow to investor confidence under President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.

day_61.headline: Shattered by Years of War, Syria Braces for Coronavirus Spread
day_61.abstract: The spread of coronavirus to Syria brings the prospect of a deadly outbreak to a population devastated by nine years of war, with ravaged hospitals and tightly-packed camps likely to accelerate infection, doctors and aid workers said on Monday.

day_61.headline: In Daily Coronavirus Briefing, Trump Tries to Redefine Himself
day_61.abstract: The briefing has given him a unique perch from which he can talk about the pandemic and try to project leadership after initially minimizing it. But that’s not always what he has done.

day_62.headline: Partier in 'if I Get Corona, I Get Corona' Video Apologizes
day_62.abstract: A Florida spring breaker has apologized for saying in a viral video last week that he wouldn't let warnings about the coronavirus stop him from partying and “if I get corona, I get corona.”

day_62.headline: Man Who Said, ‘If I Get Corona, I Get Corona,’ Apologizes
day_62.abstract: A beachgoer whose defiance of social distancing guidelines drew widespread attention said that he had not been “aware of the severity of my actions and comments.”

day_62.headline: Austria Bets on Mass Testing to Manage Coronavirus Spread
day_62.abstract: Austria will massively expand coronavirus testing in coming days to locate and isolate infected people and avoid an Italian-like overload of its health system, Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Tuesday.

day_62.headline: Wait … How Do We Live Together?
Coronavirus Spurs a Wave of Suspect Websites Looking to Cash In
day_62.abstract: Hundreds of e-commerce sites are popping up daily to sell virus-fighting products. Many are being shut down for making exaggerated claims or selling phantom products.

day_62.headline: Likud Members Urge Speaker to Defy Israeli High Court Order
day_62.abstract: Israel appeared on the verge of a constitutional crisis Tuesday as top members of Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud urged their party colleague and parliament speaker to defy a Supreme Court order to let lawmakers hold a vote for his successor.

day_62.headline: I’m a Calamity Obsessive. After My Trip to Italy, I Was the Calamity.
day_62.abstract: I wasn’t planning to be on vacation in a pandemic. It changed the way I’ll think about risk forever.

day_62.headline: Business Fallout: Nike Cites Jump in Online Sales in China
day_62.abstract: The rapid spread of the coronavirus since it was first reported in China has dealt an unprecedented shock to the global economy. Here's a look at developments Tuesday as central banks, businesses and workers attempt to navigate a global outbreak that has brought economic activity to a standstill.

day_62.headline: Stocks Surge on Hopes for Economic Rescue Deal
day_62.abstract: Live updates on stock market and business news during the coronavirus outbreak.

day_63.headline: Corona Shutdown Strands Thousands at Istanbul Airport
day_63.abstract: Around 2,000 people have been stranded for a week at Istanbul Airport by a shutdown of flights to stem the spread of coronavirus, the airport's operator said on Wednesday.

day_63.headline: German Cathedral Dusts Off Relics of St Corona, Patron of Epidemics
day_63.abstract: Germany's Aachen Cathedral has dug out the relics of little-known Saint Corona, patron saint of resisting epidemics, from its treasure chamber and is polishing up her elaborate shrine to go on show once the coronavirus pandemic has passed.

day_63.headline: Club Med Takes on the Frugals in EU 'Corona Bond' Bailout Battle
day_63.abstract: Leaders of nine EU countries urged the bloc on Wednesday to issue a "common debt instrument" to cushion their economies from the shock of the coronavirus crisis, challenging Germany and others adamantly opposed to pooling risk across the continent.

day_63.headline: Thyssenkrupp to Cut 3,000 Jobs at Steel Unit by 2026
day_63.abstract: The German elevator-to-car parts conglomerate Thyssenkrupp will cut 3,000 jobs at its steel unit by 2026 as part of a wage deal it struck with powerful labor union IG Metall, it said on Wednesday.

day_63.headline: Nine EU Leaders Call for Joint Debt Issuance for Coronavirus Spending
day_63.abstract: Leaders of nine EU countries including France, Italy and Spain called on the bloc to agree on a "common debt instrument" to raise funds to support the health industry in combating the coronavirus, as well as the broader economies, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

day_63.headline: New Jersey Slaps Terror Charge on Man Over Alleged Supermarket Cough Threat
day_63.abstract: A New Jersey man has been charged with making terroristic threats after he was accused of coughing on a supermarket employee and saying he was infected with the coronavirus behind the ongoing pandemic, authorities said Tuesday.

day_63.headline: In Japan, Hotels Lose Out on Olympic Bet as Coronavirus Spreads
day_63.abstract: The Osaka Corona Hotel in western Japan has been eerily quiet and empty the past few weeks.

day_63.headline: Refugees to the Rescue? Germany Taps Migrant Medics to Battle Virus
day_63.abstract: Five years ago the arrival of a wave of refugees caused much consternation and fueled support for Germany's far-right. Now, the country is turning to its migrant community to plug an anticipated shortage of medical staff battling the coronavirus.

day_63.headline: Neighbors Are Reaching Out on Nextdoor
day_63.abstract: Homebound city dwellers are turning to a neighborhood app to connect, organize and help each other without risking physical contact.

day_63.headline: Saudis Tighten Anti-Virus Curfew; UAE Closures Leave Travellers Stranded
day_63.abstract: Saudi Arabia reported its second coronavirus death and tightened a nationwide curfew on Wednesday, barring travel in and out of Riyadh, the capital, and the holy cities of Mecca and Medina, as well as movement between all provinces.

day_64.headline: Bosch Develops Corona Test Tool to Detect Virus in Under Three Hours
day_64.abstract: Robert Bosch on Thursday said it has developed a diagnostic tool for detecting the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 in under three hours, potentially aiding the challenge of understanding how far the virus has spread.

day_64.headline: 'Most Photographed' NYSE Trader Contracts Coronavirus
day_64.abstract: Peter Tuchman, dubbed the "most photographed trader on Wall Street", took to Instagram on Thursday to tell his 10,000-odd followers that he had tested positive for coronavirus.

day_64.headline: German Baker Cleans Up With Toilet Roll Cakes
day_64.abstract: A German baker has drummed up some much-needed demand during the coronavirus crisis by making cakes in the shape of toilet rolls.

day_64.headline: Internet Firm Restricts Virus-Themed Website Registrations
day_64.abstract: An internet firm is ending the automated registration of website names that include words or phrases related to the COVID-19 pandemic, an attempt to combat coronavirus-related fraud.

day_64.headline: Germany Still in Calm Before Coronavirus Storm: Health Minister
day_64.abstract: Germany is still in "the calm before the storm" of the coronavirus epidemic and is using the time it has won with extensive testing to prepare for a wave of cases expected in the coming weeks, Health Minister Jens Spahn said on Thursday.

day_64.headline: Lebanon Extends Coronavirus Lockdown by Two Weeks
day_64.abstract: Lebanon is extending a lockdown by two weeks until April 12 to combat the spread of the coronavirus, its information minister  said on Thursday, while introducing strict new steps that seemed to amount to an overnight curfew in all but name.

day_64.headline: LeBron Talks About Virus' Impact on NBA in Podcast
day_64.abstract: Los Angeles Lakers superstar LeBron James shed light on a variety of topics facing the NBA should it attempt to resume the 2019-20 season later this year.

day_64.headline: Crisis Management Boosts Merkel's Conservatives in Poll
day_64.abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative bloc has risen in public opinion thanks to the government's management of the coronavirus crisis, with a poll on Thursday putting it at the highest level since a 2017 federal election.

day_64.headline: Here’s a Coronavirus Quiz
day_64.abstract: Test your currency with current events.

day_64.headline: Fearing Coronavirus, African City Dwellers Flee to the Countryside
day_64.abstract: Each morning at a crowded bus station east of Nairobi, Kenyans load their bags on to minibuses emblazoned with the faces of pop stars and Jesus, heading to their villages in the hope of escaping the coronavirus.

day_65.headline: Europol: Criminals Exploit Virus Crisis as Fresh Opportunity
day_65.abstract: Criminals are preying on a fearful public and disrupting the provision of medical care during the coronavirus pandemic by selling counterfeit products, impersonating health workers and hacking computers as many citizens do their jobs online at home, European law enforcement agency Europol said Friday.

day_65.headline: Of ‘Covidivorces’ and ‘Coronababies’: Life During a Lockdown
day_65.abstract: Across the world, the pandemic is radically altering approaches to love, dating, sex and family relations.

day_65.headline: European Shares Fall After Three-Day Rally, but Mark Best Week Since 2011
day_65.abstract: European shares closed in the red on Friday after EU lawmakers failed to agree on a coronavirus rescue package and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced he had been infected.

day_65.headline: Hedge Fund Fir Tree Puts $410 Million Dislocation Fund to Work
day_65.abstract: After years of waiting and watching from afar, hedge fund Fir Tree Partners is spending $410 million from its dislocation funds on stocks, pockets of the credit market and other securities, sure the historic market sell-off made new bargains.

day_65.headline: Germany Looks at Tracking Patients to Rein in Coronavirus-Reports
day_65.abstract: Germany has proposed using big data and location tracking to isolate people with coronavirus once social distancing measures now in force have slowed its spread, media reported on Friday.

day_65.headline: In Iran, False Belief a Poison Fights Virus Kills Hundreds
day_65.abstract: Standing over the still body of an intubated 5-year-old boy wearing nothing but a plastic diaper, an Iranian health care worker in a hazmat suit and mask begged the public for just one thing: Stop drinking industrial alcohol over fears about the new coronavirus.

day_65.headline: It’s Not All Bad. Here’s Proof.
day_65.abstract: We’re highlighting some of the more heartening things that caught our attention as the world mobilizes against the coronavirus pandemic.

day_65.headline: U.S. Companies, Labs Rush to Produce Blood Test for Coronavirus Immunity
day_65.abstract: As the United States works overtime to screen thousands for the novel coronavirus, a new blood test offers the chance to find out who may have immunity - a potential game changer in the battle to contain infections and get the economy back on track.

day_65.headline: A Riding Center for the Disabled Struggles to Care for Its Herd
day_65.abstract: An organization that provides therapeutic riding lessons for people with disabilities said a tearful goodbye amid fears over the spread of coronavirus.

day_65.headline: NOT REAL NEWS: Debunking Yet More False Coronavirus Content
day_65.abstract: A roundup of some of the most popular but completely untrue stories and visuals of the week. None of these are legit, even though they were shared widely on social media. The Associated Press checked them out. Here are the facts:

day_66.headline: Syria Bans Most Domestic Travel in Coronavirus Lockdown
day_66.abstract: Syria said on Friday it was banning travel between cities and governorates as part of tightening measures to curb the spread of coronavirus, state-run Ikhbariya TV reported, citing the interior minister.

day_66.headline: Lebanon's Berri May Suspend Cabinet Support Over Coronavirus Expat Policy
day_66.abstract: Lebanese Parliament Speaker Nabih Berri threatened on Saturday to suspend his support for Prime Minister Hassan Diab's government if it did not act to bring home expatriates stranded abroad during the coronavirus pandemic.

day_66.headline: Iran to Use 20% of State Budget to Fight Coronavirus
day_66.abstract: Iran is to allocate 20% of its annual state budget to fighting the coronavirus outbreak in the country, one of the worst-hit in the world, President Hassan Rouhani said on Saturday.

day_66.headline: A Wall. A Ball. That’s All: Your New Social-Distancing Workout
day_66.abstract: Long-ignored vertical slabs all over the city are having a moment.

day_66.headline: Finding Comfort in a Bottle of Familiar Wine
day_66.abstract: In times of fear and anxiety, we find solace in foods that conjure up memories and emotions. Why not wines?

day_66.headline: Parents Work on the Front Lines. Where Do Their Children Go All Day?
day_66.abstract: An experimental program attempts to fill the void of shuttered public schools.

day_66.headline: In the Coronavirus Fight in Scandinavia, Sweden Stands Apart
day_66.abstract: The country has drawn global attention with an unorthodox approach while its neighbors have imposed extensive restrictions.

day_66.headline: A Silent Spring Is Saying Something
day_66.abstract: The eerie inhumanity of Donald Trump.

day_66.headline: 'Just One Case': Fears Coronavirus May Spread Like Wildfire in World's Refugee Camps
day_66.abstract: In the world’s largest refugee settlement in Bangladesh, filmmaker Mohammed Arafat has been making public safety videos to warn about the dangers of coronavirus.

day_66.headline: How the Young Deal With the Coronavirus
day_66.abstract: High school and college students urge their cohort to take the threat seriously, and adults reassure the young that past adversities and uncertainties have been overcome.

day_67.headline: Modi Seeks 'Forgiveness' From India's Poor Over Coronavirus Lockdown
day_67.abstract: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked the nation's poor for forgiveness on Sunday, as the economic and human toll from his 21-day nationwide lockdown deepens and criticism mounts about a lack of adequate planning ahead of the decision.

day_67.headline: German Health Institute Warns Pandemic Could Overstretch System - Paper
day_67.abstract: Germany's health system could face strains similar to those in Italy if the coronavirus outbreak in the country worsens, the head of the Robert Koch Institute (RKI), the federal agency responsible for disease control, told a newspaper.

day_67.headline: Uganda's Bobi Wine Sings Against Virus, Criticizes Leaders
day_67.abstract: Ugandan pop star and opposition leader Bobi Wine, who released a song urging Africa's people to wash their hands to stop the spread of the new coronavirus, is criticizing African governments for not maintaining better health care systems for the continent's 1.3 billion people.

day_67.headline: New York City's Poorer Neighborhoods Hit Hardest by Virus
day_67.abstract: As coronavirus cases in New York City topped 30,000, President Donald Trump said he would issue a travel advisory urging people in the region to avoid traveling out of the area for 14 days. Mayor Bill de Blasio said Sunday he worried the advisory would keep some families apart.

day_67.headline: India’s Coronavirus Lockdown Leaves Vast Numbers Stranded and Hungry
day_67.abstract: Millions of migrant laborers in Indian cities live and eat where they work, and the sudden shutdown of businesses has upended their lives. Anger is rising.

day_67.headline: Oil Prices Crash, Virus Hits, Commerce Stops: Iraq Is in Trouble.
day_67.abstract: Iraq depends on oil revenues, which have plummeted. The country is so desperate it is asking for donations to help it weather the pandemic.

day_67.headline: Coronavirus Live Updates: Pelosi Accuses Trump of ‘Deadly’ Denial; New York Mayor Says Medical Supplies Will Run Out in a Week
day_67.abstract: The world largest lockdown brings chaos and hunger to India, and the global tally of cases rises past 670,000. A U.S. judge orders migrant children released.

day_68.headline: Red Bull's Marko Suggested 'Corona Camp' for F1 Drivers
day_68.abstract: Red Bull's motorsport head Helmut Marko suggested his Formula One and junior drivers should catch the coronavirus while racing is on hold so they would be protected from sickness later in the year.

day_68.headline: In Jerusalem, a Palestinian Family Under Coronavirus Lockdown
day_68.abstract: A Palestinian English teacher, Jizelle Sara, faces a double challenge while observing a partial lockdown in her Jerusalem home during the coronavirus crisis.

day_68.headline: For India’s Laborers, Coronavirus Lockdown Is an Order to Starve
day_68.abstract: Despite leaders’ decrees on staying home, laborers who live hand-to-mouth say they have no choice but to keep hitting the streets. Here are their stories.

day_68.headline: Short-Selling Bans Not Useful: Stock Exchanges Federation
day_68.abstract: Bans on the short-selling of shares when stock markets are experiencing extreme volatility gives the impression of a decisive response without achieving any useful result, the World Federation of Exchanges (WFE) said on Monday.

day_68.headline: Denmark Eyes Gradual Reopening After Easter if Coronavirus Numbers Stabilize
day_68.abstract: Denmark may gradually lift a lockdown after Easter if the numbers of coronavirus cases and deaths remain stable, Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said on Monday.

day_68.headline: Germany Aims to Launch Singapore-Style Coronavirus App in Weeks
day_68.abstract: Germany hopes to launch a smartphone app within weeks to help trace coronavirus infections, after a broad political consensus emerged that adopting an approach pioneered by Singapore can be effective without invading people's privacy.

day_68.headline: Some Ultra-Orthodox Israelis Chafe at Coronavirus Restrictions
day_68.abstract: Israeli police have used a drone, helicopter and stun grenades in recent days to prevent people gathering in an ultra-Orthodox Jewish neighborhood of Jerusalem in defiance of Health Ministry measures aimed at slowing the spread of the coronavirus.

day_68.headline: Coronavirus Hits Rich and Poor Unequally in Latin America
day_68.abstract: From Mexico City to Port-au-Prince, Haiti, and Santiago, Chile, the coronavirus is taking root in the world’s most unequal region, where many of Latin America's first cases arrived with members of the elite returning from vacations or work trips to Europe and the United States.

day_68.headline: Virus Soars Among Ultra-Orthodox Jews as Many Flout Israel’s Rules
day_68.abstract: Failure to comply with government restrictions is causing the coronavirus to spread in ultra-Orthodox communities up to eight times faster than elsewhere in Israel.

day_68.headline: The Quarantine Diaries
day_68.abstract: Around the world, the history of our present moment is taking shape in journal entries and drawings.

day_69.headline: A Coronavirus Thriller Was Finished Just Before the Shutdown
day_69.abstract: A Canadian filmmaker read the headlines, and a few weeks later a shoot was underway on a story addressing xenophobia and the pandemic. Then film festivals were canceled.

day_69.headline: Germany Faces Big Growth Hit in First Half, Second-Half Recovery Possible: Minister
day_69.abstract: The German economy faces a major setback in the March-May period but there is still a chance it could make up some of that lost ground in the second half of the year, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier told the Rheinische Post newspaper.

day_69.headline: Waiving Rent and Making Masks, Afghans Meet Coronavirus With Kindness
day_69.abstract: The health crisis, which has become a fresh test of survival for a country where life has been a daily fight for decades, has provoked a shared sense of responsibility and spontaneous acts of generosity.

day_69.headline: India and Pakistan Crack Down on Muslim Group Emerging as COVID-19 Cluster
day_69.abstract: India and Pakistan sealed off centers belonging to a Muslim missionary group on Tuesday and began investigating how many coronavirus cases were linked to its activities.

day_69.headline: White House Economists Warned in 2019 a Pandemic Could Devastate America
day_69.abstract: A study published last fall went unheeded. One of its authors now says economic shutdowns to fight the coronavirus could last up to eight months.

day_69.headline: How ‘Unorthodox’ Captured One Woman’s Flight From Hasidic Brooklyn
day_69.abstract: Deborah Feldman left her ultra-Orthodox Jewish community for a new life in Berlin. She talked about what it has been like having her autobiography adapted for Netflix.

day_69.headline: 'It Is Brutal': Hollywood's Rank-And-File on the Pandemic
day_69.abstract: The red carpets are rolled up in storage, the A-listers holed up in mansions, multiplex doors are closed. For now, at least, the coronavirus has shut down much of Hollywood. And for the entertainment industry's many one-gig-at-a-time staff and freelance workers — a quarter-million people in Los Angeles County alone — it's an economic disaster.

day_69.headline: With the Coronavirus, It’s Again Trump vs. Mother Nature
day_69.abstract: The president’s failure to understand his limits is very costly.

day_69.headline: Crammed in Filthy Cells, Political Prisoners Fear Infection
day_69.abstract: Reza Khandan got the word from friends locked away in Iran’s most feared prison, Evin. A prisoner and a guard in their cell block had been removed because they were suspected of having coronavirus, and two guards in the women’s ward had shown symptoms.

day_69.headline: Venezuela Fuel Shortages Hinder Food Delivery Amid Coronavirus Quarantine
day_69.abstract: Venezuela's fuel shortages are causing growing complications for the production and delivery of food to a crisis-stricken nation that is in quarantine to stop the spread of the coronavirus, according to ten food industry sources.

day_70.headline: A Month of Coronavirus in New York City: See the Hardest-Hit Areas
day_70.abstract: New data released by the city shows that lower-income neighborhoods have been most affected by the virus.

day_70.headline: 44 Texas Students Have Coronavirus After Spring Break Trip
day_70.abstract: A group of about 70 students from the University of Texas at Austin celebrated spring break in Mexico, then returned to find that dozens had tested positive.

day_70.headline: Coronavirus Misbehavior: When Was Licking a Toilet Ever a Good Idea?
day_70.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic has brought fear, panic and pranksters. In some cases, bad behavior has crossed the line into criminal terrorist acts.

day_70.headline: Boom in Denmark's Economy May Be Replaced by 10% Contraction, Central Bank Says
day_70.abstract: A boom in Denmark's economy may be replaced by a contraction of as much as 10% this year as the coronavirus outbreak hits the Nordic economy, the country's central bank said on Wednesday.

day_70.headline: EU Exec Proposes Shorter Work Hours to Prevent Layoffs Amid Epidemic
day_70.abstract: The EU executive proposed on Wednesday a wage-subsidy scheme to encourage employers to cut workers' hours rather than their jobs amid the coronavirus epidemic, a plan that could be worth 100 billion euros in borrowing guaranteed by all EU countries.

day_70.headline: UN Security Council Urges Cease-Fire in Afghanistan
day_70.abstract: The U.N. Security Council urged Afghanistan’s warring parties on Tuesday to heed the U.N. secretary-general’s call for an immediate cease-fire to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and ensure delivery of humanitarian aid throughout the country.

day_70.headline: Virus Outbreak Creates New Challenges for Addiction Recovery
day_70.abstract: Charlie Campbell, nearly 13 years sober, is feeling tested today more than ever to stay that way.

day_70.headline: ‘We Are the Silent First Responders’: The Workers Who Make America Work
day_70.abstract: Exposed and afraid but determined, workers who have no choice but to confront the pandemic describe their changed world in their own words.

day_71.headline: Germans Snitch on Neighbours Flouting Virus Rules, in Echo of the Stasi Past
day_71.abstract: Law-abiding Germans are zealously helping police crack down on  people flouting new social distancing rules aimed at slowing the spread of the coronavirus by reporting on strangers, neighbours and friends.

day_71.headline: Nivea-Maker Beiersdorf Scraps 2020 Outlook Due to Coronavirus Crisis
day_71.abstract: Nivea-maker Beiersdorf on Thursday scrapped its 2020 outlook due to the coronavirus pandemic, and also released preliminary first-quarter sales that showed a 3.6% fall from a year earlier.

day_71.headline: Coronavirus Compounds Lebanon's Woes, Many Struggle for Food
day_71.abstract: Battered by Lebanon's economic crisis, Hassan Zeitar was already struggling to keep his family fed when the coronavirus lockdown stripped him of the little money he made as a minibus driver.

day_71.headline: Virus Hits NYC Hardest in a Few Working-Class Neighborhoods
day_71.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic has hit especially hard in a few poorer New York City neighborhoods where telecommuting isn’t an option for many workers and there are more likely to be many people living under one roof.

day_71.headline: Kill the Virus, Not Democracy-EU Tells Hungary
day_71.abstract: The European Commission told Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orban on Thursday that emergency powers he has assumed to combat the coronavirus outbreak risk upending democracy and must be subject to proper parliamentary and media scrutiny.

day_71.headline: Residents Snitch on Businesses, Neighbors Amid Shutdowns
day_71.abstract: One Tulsa, Oklahoma, bar owner said more than a dozen motorcyclists showed up unannounced, but he served them a round of shots anyway to celebrate a birthday. Another live-streamed a drag queen show on Facebook while up to 20 people drank inside the locked bar, ignoring police when they knocked on the door.

day_71.headline: The World’s Great Photographers, Many Stuck Inside, Have Snapped
day_71.abstract: Stephen Shore, Catherine Opie, Todd Hido and others have turned to Instagram to cure ‘corona claustrophobia’ or show how life has changed. They talk about their quarantine pics.

day_71.headline: Ex-Wife Sick. Daughter Sick. 3 Friends Dead. Everyone Knows Someone.
day_71.abstract: The growing number of coronavirus cases and deaths have touched family and social circles across New York City, making the invisible threat seem far more real.

day_71.headline: Exclusive: How Elite U.S. College Students Brought Covid-19 Home From Campus
day_71.abstract: Like many American colleges, Vanderbilt University in Nashville announced last month it was closing its dormitories and putting classes online because of the growing threat of coronavirus. It said it was acting "out of an abundance of caution" after a local healthcare worker had tested positive for the disease.

day_71.headline: EU Consumers May Be Able to Bring Dieselgate Claims in Home Court: Adviser
day_71.abstract: EU consumers should be able to sue carmakers in their national courts if they have bought cars with emission cheat devices installed, an adviser to the Court of Justice of the European Union said on Thursday.

day_72.headline: Corona Beer to Halt Production Amid Coronavirus Outbreak
day_72.abstract: The suspension was announced days after the Mexican government ordered nonessential businesses to close.

day_72.headline: Take Five: Life in the Time of Corona
Mexico Without Corona: Brewers Suspend Production During Pandemic
day_72.abstract: Mexicans fretted about beer supplies on Friday after Dutch brewer Heineken said it will suspend production at its seven plants in Mexico to comply with coronavirus containment measures, following a similar announcement by rival Modelo.

day_72.headline: Mexico Stops Brewing Corona Beer, Deemed Non-Essential in Epidemic
day_72.abstract: Mexico's Grupo Modelo said on Thursday it will temporarily stop brewing Corona beer and other brands exported to 180 countries after its business activities were declared non-essential under a government order aimed at curbing the spread of the  coronavirus.

day_72.headline: Constellation Brands Says Mexico Breweries Still Running Amid Coronavirus Outbreak
day_72.abstract: Constellation Brands Inc, the U.S. distributor of Corona beer, said on Friday its Mexican breweries were still operational and supply to the United States was intact even as rivals suspended production due to the coronavirus pandemic.

day_72.headline: Walmart Limits Store Access; US Airlines Sign Up for Grants
day_72.abstract: The outbreak of the coronavirus has dealt a shock to the global economy with unprecedented speed. Following are developments on Friday related to the global economy, the work place and the spread of the virus.

day_72.headline: EU Open to All Options to Finance Coronavirus Fight: Dombrovskis
day_72.abstract: The European Union's executive is open to all options to fight the coronavirus emergency, Commission vice president Valdis Dombrovskis told Italian daily La Repubblica when asked if Brussels favoured eurobonds.

day_72.headline: Masks Do Reduce Spread of Flu and Some Coronaviruses, Study Finds
day_72.abstract: Face masks could help limit the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to researchers who studied the effect of surgical masks on the transmission of other corona and flu viruses.

day_72.headline: Hungary's Orban Strikes Back at EU Criticism on Extra Powers
day_72.abstract: Hungary’s prime minister struck back at his critics in the European Union, saying he has “no time” for dealing with some of them during the coronavirus pandemic and accusing others of wanting to “loot” the country.

day_72.headline: The Imperative of Personal Sacrifice, Today and During World War II
day_72.abstract: Are Americans as willing to making sacrifices today in response to the coronavirus, compared to in the 1940s? A historian explains.

day_73.headline: Contagious Singing as Corona Community Chorus Unites Voices
day_73.abstract: Casper ter Kuile lights a candle in front of his computer screen. And then the music begins.

day_73.headline: A German Exception? Why the Country’s Coronavirus Death Rate Is Low
day_73.abstract: The pandemic has hit Germany hard, with more than 92,000 people infected. But the percentage of fatal cases has been remarkably low compared to those in many neighboring countries.

day_73.headline: All I Wanted Was to Be Interrogated
day_73.abstract: On a reporter’s 27-hour journey from Hong Kong to New York City, hardly anyone seemed to care about her health.

day_73.headline: Coronavirus in America: A Highlight Reel
day_73.abstract: More than half of humankind is putting life on hold so that others may live. We asked readers to share the moments that are inspiring them through a time of crisis.

day_73.headline: Larry David, Master of His Quarantine
day_73.abstract: Who better than the father of “Seinfeld” and “Curb Your Enthusiasm” to guide us through the thicket of being together, alone?

day_74.headline: Lebanese Stranded Abroad by Coronavirus Outbreak Return Home
day_74.abstract: Several flights carrying Lebanese stranded abroad by coronavirus lockdowns began arriving in Beirut on Sunday, part of a trial run to see whether thousands looking to come home can be safely repatriated without worsening the country's outbreak.

day_74.headline: I’m a Doctor at the ‘Epicenter of the Epicenter’
day_74.abstract: Let’s not forget the social failures that allowed Covid-19 to overwhelm neighborhoods like Elmhurst in Queens.

day_74.headline: Virus Cancels Anniversary Event for Deadly Mine Explosion
day_74.abstract: A planned public gathering was shelved on the 10th anniversary of the worst U.S. mining disaster in decades. Heartfelt speeches gave way Sunday to silent remembrances and individual prayers for the 29 men who died at the Upper Big Branch mine in West Virginia.

day_74.headline: 'Complete Collapse of Economies' Ahead as Africa Faces Virus
day_74.abstract: Some of Uganda’s poorest people used to work here, on the streets of Kampala, as fruit sellers sitting on the pavement or as peddlers of everything from handkerchiefs to roasted peanuts.

day_74.headline: Of Beards and Bubonic Plague: German Village Prays for a (2nd) Miracle
day_74.abstract: In 1633 the Bavarian village of Oberammergau, ravaged by a pandemic, made a pledge to God. Now another pandemic has forced villagers to abandon their promise.
